title: Balancing High Mileage With Full Time Work
excerpt: Yowana Wamala manages to run 100-mile weeks while balancing a full-time job and running a business. This episode explores his approach to consistency, pacing, and mental resilience.
body:
Imagine setting out early before dawn, knowing you need to log forty miles this day while also preparing for a full day managing your business and a nine to five job. The choice to run this volume does not come from a place of casual enthusiasm but from a series of careful decisions about pacing and energy management within tight daily windows. This reality forces a runner to accept restrictions on time and recovery as part of the ongoing process rather than obstacles to be overcome in a single burst.

For anyone training under competing demands of professional life and personal commitments, this scenario underscores a deeper perspective on consistency. It is not simply about hitting high numbers but about sustaining presence over time while adapting expectations and push based on mental and physical feedback. Such an approach invites patience and redefines progress as a matter of steady engagement rather than intensity alone, fostering resilience that endures beyond any single run.
keyTakeaway: Practice consistent pacing and strategic time use to maintain steady training volume amid busy work and life schedules.
